definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: All these facilities help society reduce the generation gap between the elderly and the others.
sentences.chinese: 這可以協助縮小老人和其他人之間的代溝。

sentences.english: There are big generation gaps between each decade.
sentences.chinese: 每隔10年就有很大的代溝。

sentences.english: Generation gaps are present in every part of the world.
Educationalists say that generation gap is a source of complaints from both parents and children.
sentences.chinese: 教育家們說父母們和孩子們都在抱怨“代溝”現象。

sentences.english: Another worry, for some, is the growing generation gap.
sentences.chinese: 對某些人來說還有一種憂慮，就是不斷增長的代溝。

sentences.english: Have you ever experienced a gap between younger and older generations of people in your country?
sentences.chinese: 你們國家的新一代和老一代之間有代溝嗎？

sentences.english: Still, Scheer said, there was a digital divide in Germany that needed to be bridged.
sentences.chinese: 他還說，目前德國社會存在一個需要彌合的數碼代溝。

sentences.english: Generation gap, conservation, reminiscence, pedantry and stubbornness all basically derive from that.
sentences.chinese: 代溝，保守，懷舊，迂腐頑固，基本都源於此。

sentences.english: Generation gap arises from a lack of communication between the young and the old.
sentences.chinese: 代溝的產生是由於青老年間缺乏交流。

sentences.english: The generation gap ensues there is lack of communication between parents and children.
sentences.chinese: 當家長和孩子之間缺乏溝通的時候，代溝就出現了。

sentences.english: Both parents and teenagers must try to bridge the generation gap between them.
sentences.chinese: 父母和青少年雙方必須盡力彌合代溝。

sentences.english: So the generation gap is ineluctable , as long as the exactitude treats all right.
sentences.chinese: 所以代溝是不可避免的，只要正確對待就可以了。

sentences.english: The film's themes are involving inter-generational conflict and the rise of new temptations .
sentences.chinese: 電影的主題是關於代溝和新的誘惑。

definition: hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
see 沒關係|没关系[mei2 guan1 xi5]
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
